term.name: authoritarianism
term.source: From French autorite: power or right to enforce obedience.
term.def: The idea that a leader or government possesses moral or legal supremacy and the right to command others without their consent. Although authoritarianism is sometimes considered to involve a less egregious violation of human rights than &totalitarianism;, it is still actively opposed to any form of &liberalism; or &libertarianism;.
